text: Unity’s coordinate system is “Y-up.” What does that mean?
skills: Navigate in 3D space in the Scene view

options.text: Y measures distance from the current viewpoint in the direction of view.
Y goes up from zero only; the ground is the lower vertical limit.
Y is vertical, and X and Z are horizontal.

feedbackCorrect: “Y-up” means that the Y dimension goes up and down. X and Z are similar to east-west and north-south (depending on your point of view).
feedbackIncorrect: “Y-up” means that the Y dimension goes up and down. X and Z are similar to east-west and north-south (depending on your point of view).
